segments.text: That sink is a disaster, water just wasting away everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet's been left on, and no one's stopping it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's drying a plate right there, ignoring the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are making it worse with their cookie raid.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Boy's on that rickety stool, fingers sticky in the jar already.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Crumbly cookies dropping everywhere, adding to the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's hand out, begging for her piece of the filth.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can't they just ask instead of this sneaky business?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water's ruining the cabinets, what a sloppy scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden's clean and neat, totally opposite.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand seeing all this unnecessary waste and dirt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dish towel looks damp now from the splashes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen needs some serious cleaning up.
segments.speaker: PAR
